title: Exporting email client from Outlook to Thunderbird
creator: t.black
content:
I have successfully moved over several email addresses and then the last one stumped me! I am receiving emails on that account but only 1 of the 9 folders came over. I have tried manually adding the folders but I get error messages from TB indicating that the outlook server cannot find the folders. There are old emails in those folders that I will eventually need migrated over. What am I missing?

Also, I am required to enter my password each time I open emails from the SmarterASP email server. That is going to get old. How can I stop this?

title: unable to login
creator: johnmacalister
content:
I've just returned from a couple of months away, and want to access my emails on Thunderbird on my desktop. This is the message i get:

Login to server [...] with username [...] failed.

I've contacted my provider who say the issue is not with them but with Thunderbird. As I can access webmail ok I presume this is correct.

I have tried Troubleshoot mode, but that hasn't helped. And I've tried restarting the computer.

Any suggestions would be most gratefully received.

Thank you!

title: One folder brings TB to a halt
creator: ce_mozilla
content: This has been consistent for over a week now. One folder brings TB to a halt if I try to open any message in it. I have many folders and many I rarely open so I can't be sure it's just this folder but certainly all other folders seem fine and fast. This particular folder did have many messages in it but I deleted them all, accepting that I didn't really need them. I then repaired the folder but was a bit shocked to find the problem continues. The folder says it is 20.9Mb and that it contains three messages each of 7Mb. That's plausible as it just gets one Email per day from my server with some information. The size can vary quite a lot. I could just delete the folder and recreate one with the same filter rules, or I could delete the filter rules before doing that, or ... what?! Technical is that it is TB 140.3.1esr running on a fairly powerful Kubutu machine with 64Gb and really nowhere near any resource limits. It's pulling messages from the one IMAP server and, as I say, everything else seems fine. Any thoughts welcome, TIA, Chris
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:144.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/144.0

title: Copy Thunderbird to new computer
creator: rdarling
content:
I am trying to install Thunderbird into a new computer with Windows 11. When I try to run, it goes to a configuration page but will not connect after finding my account. I have double-checked password, but it says "Unable to log in at server . . . ".

I have uninstalled and reinstalled new program, but get the same response each time. I want to install Thunderbird (and Firefox) and copy my profiles from my old computer to the new one. I am not able to do either. I have followed the online instructions for moving/migrating both, but neither work. Any suggestions?

Rad
